Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays

Class InOutGrowableByteArray

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays.GrowableByteArray
chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays.InOutGrowableByteArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.DataInput, java.io.DataOutput, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class InOutGrowableByteArray
extends GrowableByteArray
implements java.io.DataOutput, java.io.DataInput, java.io.Flushable, java.io.Closeable

This class extends functionality of GrowableByteArray with different I/O-styled operations. To support this feature, the class implements DataOutput and DataInput interfaces. There is an internal cursor inside the class. It moves from the beginning of the array content to the end of array content during all input and output operations (it's similar to file pointer in the RandomAccessFile).

To start writing data to the array, simply use DataOutput interface methods. To start reading data from the array, simply use DataInput interface methods. You shouldn't mix calling methods from these interfaces, but you can switch I/O mode for the class by calling reset() method in the class. I/O mode for the class can be:

  • write mode - you can use DataOutput interface methods only
  • read mode - you can use DataInput interface methods only

After calling reset() both of the modes are undefined. The first call to any methods from DataOutput interface after calling reset() sets the write mode implicitly. The first call to any methods from DataInput interface after calling reset() sets the read mode implicitly.

Reading array content starts from the beginning of the array content and stops when internal cursor will be positioned after the last byte in the array. Any subsequential calls for DataInput interface methods will fire EOFException. Writing array content starts from the beginning of the array content until the last byte in the array. Any subsequential calls for DataOutput interface methods produce automatic array growing.

The most of code for this class was copied from standard JRE DataInputStream and DataOutputStream classes and adapted for the specific requirements and abilities of the GrowableByteArray class.

Calling reset() always frees specific internal resources of the class. Especially for this case, the class implements Closeable interface to support using it in the try-with-resource statements. The only action of the close() method is calling reset() method.

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JUnit tests

  • Constructor Details

    • InOutGrowableByteArray

      public InOutGrowableByteArray​(boolean usePlain)

      Create growable byte array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time

    • InOutGrowableByteArray

      public InOutGrowableByteArray​(boolean usePlain, int initialPow)

      Create growable byte array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time
      initialPow - 2^^initialPow is a piece size of the growable array.
